author: Zippolin
name: Poor Numbers, Rich Skips
comments: It's a very poor map with a high number of tech skips.

author: Leary93
name: Pamdera
sliceNames: Jeolly everra day; At my hope's end; Exiled at starpoint; Arinam for Meer, Meer for Rex; Wellonman; Hell's gate
comments: A pretty rough map with slices roughly balanced but each being different, where succes will heavily depend on the faction playing in each. Ment for those willing to take on a challenge that pushes players to fight against eachother for both economy and control thanks to the 18 red tiles

author: squirrelnest
name: The Mahact Awaken
sliceNames: Vuil'raith, Argent, Mahact, Creuss
comments: Lore-Inspired Scenario: thinking they would find a paradise world, the Creuss foolishly opened the gate to Ixth and woke the Mahact. As the Mahact fire up their ancient machines, a desperate contest is about to take place. The machines on Acheron tear space itself and a terrible new threat, the Vuil'raith emerge. The Argent scramble to fulfil their oaths as sacred guardians. Mahact prepares to propel Ixth back towards the center of the galaxy. The Creuss try to find a way to undo the ruin they've just unleashed, and prevent the Prophecy of Kings.  (Thematic note: in this scenario, points do not represent the will of the council, but progress with the understanding and use of the Acheron gates.)  Special Rules: Each player chooses one of the following races: Vuil'raith, Argent, Mahact, and Creuss. The races' starting locations can not be moved.  Mahact starts with the speaker token.  Remove the Trade and Warfare strategy cards from the game; they can never be chosen. Players will choose only one strategy card in the strategy phase.  Because there is no custodians token on this map, there will be no agenda phase. Any action card or secret objective that can only be used in the agenda phase gains the text 'ACTION: Discard this card to refresh your commodities.' (Note that this will allow Vuil'raith to use their agent.)  The first player to 8 points is the victor.

author: Spage
name: Back2Back Teamwork
comments: Slice with the A warp in Asteroids gains the speaker first.

author: Luminous
name: Twist and Turned
sliceNames: Runaway Incursion, One Sided, Hello Neighbor, One Two Three, Take what you can(,) Give Nothing Back, The Long Road
comments: I began the names of each slice with the Upper most slice that is clockwise from the furthest north tile location.   This map is intended to provide tension/conflict around Mecatol Rex, where each tile adjacent to the center is considered an equidistant system for 2 home system locations.   It is common for planetary systems of an individual slice to be adjacent to one another. As this results in a more center focused map, many of the empty space tiles were placed on the outer rim of the map.   There are very few anomalies on this map (a total of 5, 1 being a supernova), and Legendary planets are placed in a way that they are considered equidistant 2 or more slices (See wormholes).   Points of Conflict: * Any system adjacent to MR * Objectives that require Planetary types, like 4 of a type. * 1st and 2ndary tech skips have been placed in a way that some factions might need to fight one-another. * Control Objectives are much easier to disrupt do to the system adjacency of neighbors.  Starting Slices: *Factions have the option of taking systems that are equidistant to both their neighbors and can advantageous for factions that start with increased movement on ships with capacity. * I tried balancing each slice based on only the systems adjacent to the home system and what their 2 options were for systems adjacent to Mecatol Rex.  Strongest to Weakest Slice (in my opinion): 1. One Sided 2. Hello Neighbor 3. The Long Road 4. Runaway Incursion 5. One Two Three 6. Take What You Can, Give Nothing Back

author: Dimble
name: Timewarp
sliceNames: RED - Hands on your hips GREEN - Jump to the left WHITE - Drives you insane BLUE - Step to the right PURPLE - Knees in tight YELLOW - The pelvic thrust
comments: The goal of this map was to cram as many Tech Skips as I could into the map, while still making it reasonably balanced. The Red and Purple players are incentivised to fall onto the player in Yellow, and the same on the other side of the board with Green and Blue falling on White.

author: Lohruin
name: Tension
sliceNames: belligerent boar ; ancient alligator ; bashful badger ; audacious armadillo ; blissful bat ; ambitious ape
comments: In this balanced but tense map, each slice (except the 6 o' clock one) has access to 6 influence per round & has 3 planets of a given trait. The defining characteristic of ''Tension'' is every home system has a wormhole adjacent to it. Throughout the game, players will need to make difficult choices between contesting equidistant systems, reaching for Mecatol Rex, protecting their flank and attacking across the galaxy.   When playing this map, diplomatic relations will be necessary... up until everything implodes during the last round of play!  Have fun! Lohruin

author: Lamyatt
name: A Tight Belt
comments: This map was designed with an eye for balance whilst mimicking the 6 player layout, but with the primary goal to have as few planets in the central ring as possible and to place the legendary planets in the equidistants.  Conflict is encouraged with the majority of control objectives requiring players to enter opponents slices. The additional tiles in the central ring made accounting for all objectives far easier and prevents PDS2 breaking the game. All objectives should be scorable but being 3 player you always need a little flexibility with certain objectives.

author: Andromad
name: Due in December
sliceNames: Industrial Center, Build the Wall, You Guys are Getting Planets, Dubs, Hazardous Area, Grab Bag, Cultural Zone
comments: Fairly generic 7 player map with PoK tiles

author: Andromad
name: Crowded Quarters
sliceNames: Brotherhood, Uncultured, it means Friend, Where's my Money, I'm Blue, One of a Kind
comments: Every player has empty spaces on one side and a crowded border on the other side

author: Andromad
name: Shakeup
sliceNames: Don't Mind Me, Personal Space, Value?, Graveyard Shift, Cozy Blanket, See you Sunday
comments: Right side of the map has a lot of planets but also a lot of wormholes offer mobility to the other side. Top slice is safe and isolated.

author: Hornaday
name: Risky Business
sliceNames: 'Into the Abyz' 'Meer and Far' 'Nope Friends' 'Teq Me Ran, Tor Kan Me' 'Campbell's Primordial Soup' 'Good luck!'

author: zombiebrains
name: Hotline Mecatol
sliceNames: Rooster, Tiger, Cobra, Locust
comments: Each slice has easy access to the legendaries and MR. The only problem is that there is no way to really score objectives without stepping on someone's toes. Each slice has a tech skip and a few planets to get started but resources are scarce and border diputes will be inevitable without shrewd negotiation. The wormholes allow for easy neighbors and easier rivals. Equidistants have a tech specialty and lucrative systems making them very valuable.

author: zombiebrains, mtg.wiz[at]gmail.com
name: Hurts Donut
sliceNames: Bitey & Fightey, Mean & Lean, Push & Shove
comments: Before play begins, place 'Mirage' on the '77' Tile and purge the Mirage exploration card from the Frontier deck. All the legendary planets should be available and equidistant.   Each players starts off with a small slice but many opportunities to expand. Each player is presented 4 avenues, 2 to Mecatol Rex, and 2 to a legendary planet. Dividing each section is empty space or an anomaly separating each area of the map into a field rather than a slice. This map features asymmetrical warp zones on the outer ring and lots of chokepoints, but multiple avenues of attack. The center is interconnected and of very high value, making for a maelstrom of conflict around Mecatol Rex.

author: zombiebrains , mtg.wiz[at]gmail.com
name: Regicide
sliceNames: Emperor, King, Lord, Duke, Prince
comments: The Emperor starts off with a very significant advantage with both legendary planets, lots of influence, and being closer to Mecatol Rex but no way to reliably score victory points. In order to succeed, he must press outward much to the chagrin of the other players. The other slices feature resource heavy, interconnected slices, but petty infighting over objectives can quickly sour relationships. How can the other players work together to defeat the Emperor when only one of them can claim the throne?

author: UEberMonster
name: Gramsci
sliceNames: Karl, Friedrich, Antonio, John Maynard

author: UEberMonster
name: Paris Commune
sliceNames: Dombroski, Louise Michel, Varlin, Jourde

author: UEberMonster
name: 2vs2 Alliance Map
sliceNames: Luhmann, Elias, Bourdieu, Butler

author: Waffles
name: W.A.R.P. Machine
sliceNames: Planet Delta - Batman's Mellons - Quadruple Veil - Slingfluencer

author: DaveBot777
name: Poor Snowflake
sliceNames: Saudor's Kiss, Perimeter's Edge, Quan's Corner
comments: The missing tiles are treated as not a part of the map. The tiles adjacent to them do not count as on the edge of the game board.

author: DaveBot777
name: Rich Snowflake
sliceNames: The industrialist, Wormholes Optional, Bereg's Domain
comments: The missing tiles in the center are not a part of the board and are completely impassible. The tiles adjacent to them do not count as being on the edge of the game board.

author: DaveBot777
name: Legendary Chokepoints
comments: The objective for empty spaces is VERY difficult on this map.

author: DaveBot777
name: Total Asymmetry
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated.

author: DaveBot777
name: Outer Rim
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated.

author: DaveBot777
name: 6-6 All Around
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated. This map is meant to be a very basic map that is well balanced. It is meant to give all players access to 2 CTs and 6 resources per round.

author: DaveBot777
name: Equidistant Wars
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated. This map places the some of the best systems in the game as the equidistant systems. Players will be negotiating and in conflict right from the start.

author: DaveBot777
name: The Great Divide
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated.   This map divides players with a wall of anomalies. This map is as experimental as they come. Both half's are connected by wormholes and have a gravity rift for risky plays to each other's home systems.

author: DaveBot777
name: Warzone Rex
comments: The map string may be a little wonky. I have it setup so the homesystems are in slightly different spots than a standard 4p map string. The map is functionally equivalent to a standard map in every way it is just rotated.   This map puts homesystems closer to the center. It also put's player's optimal forward dock locations adjacent to mecatol and 1 other player's optimal forward dock location to create a tense environment.

author: DaveBot777
name: Quadrant
sliceNames: Sem-Lore's Curse, The Lay of Lisis, Star's Point, Centari's Fall
comments: Hehe. This was fun to make.   When playing with this map, the enforced travel ban law should be removed from the deck.

author: DaveBot777
name: Max's Dream 5p
comments: Money. Lot's of money.

author: DaveBot777
name: Warpless Zone
comments: This is a somewhat balanced 5 player map that doesn't use warp zones.

author: DaveBot777
name: Equidistant++ 5p
comments: A non-standard map layout that adds an extra equidistant tile between each set of adjacent players. It's a good layout for player's like me that like a little more money in their galaxy and to play 14 point games.

author: DaveBot777
name: Outer Rim 5p
comments: This map forces action on the edge of the board and drives players away from the center.

author: DaveBot777
name: Large BAT 5p
comments: Note on the Asymmetric comment. The map is actually decently balanced, but not everyone has access to the same stuff.   BAT stands for balance through asymmetry.

author: DaveBot777
name: All Lanes Closed
comments: This is a non-standard 5 player map layout without hyperlanes.

author: DaveBot777
name: Small and Rich 5p
comments: A standard sized map with most of the best systems in play.

author: DaveBot777
name: Teardrop
comments: This map is weird.

author: DaveBot777
name: The infamous Double Galaxy 5p
comments: This map starts with a gamma wormhole on Mecatol Rex. This map is a trip and a half. For this map the wormhole nexus does not count as the edge of the game board and the central empty tiles in the mecatol galaxy are impassible and the adjacent systems are not treated as the edge of the game board.   When playing this map 1 of the 3 gamma wormhole tokens starts on Mecatol Rex. In addition, the agenda Nexus sovereignty and Enforced travel ban should be removed from the agenda deck.

author: DaveBot777
name: The Infamous Double Galaxy
comments: This map starts with a gamma wormhole on Mecatol Rex. When playing with this map the Nexus Sovereignty Agenda and Enforced Travel Ban Agendas must be removed at the start of the game and a gamma wormhole must be placed on Mecatol Rex.  I am submitting this a second time because I put in the wrong map string on the previous one. My bad.

author: DaveBot777
name: Half-War Dogs
comments: Half of the homesystems start forward. This map is not balanced well and should be played with some sort of drafting method.

author: DaveBot777
name: Max's Dream 6p
comments: Big galaxy. Much money. Very wow.

author: DaveBot777
name: Equidistant ++
comments: Adds an extra equidistant between each pair of adjacent players.

author: DaveBot777
name: Outer Rim 6p
comments: Pushes the action to the edge of the map and keeps people out of the center.

author: DaveBot777
name: Boredom
comments: Boring slices. Basically what happens if you do the standard map setup optimally and everyone gets equalish systems.

author: DaveBot777
name: Unknown
comments: A slightly larger than normal galaxy with a hyperlane to the right. There is an ever so slight asymmetry in the map between your left and right neighbor.

author: DaveBot777
name: Lefty Lane
comments: This is a slightly larger than normal map that has a hyper lane to the left. This causes a slight asymmetry between your left and right neighbors.

author: DaveBot777
name: Small and Rich 6p
comments: Standard map size with the best systems in play.

author: DaveBot777
name: All Lanes Lead to Rex
comments: This is a slightly larger galaxy with increased distance between players. Good for a 14 point game.

author: DaveBot777
name: The Infamous Double Galaxy 6p
comments: This map requires a gamma wormhole to be placed on Mecatol Rex during setup. In addition, the Nexus Sovereignty and Enforced Travel ban agendas must be removed from the agenda deck at the start of the game.

author: DaveBot777
name: Diamond
comments: Why did I make this? What's the point? I don't know, but it looks cool.

author: DaveBot777
name: Helix
sliceNames: Biotic Beaver, Focal Fossa, Groovy Gorilla, Xenial Xerus, Trust Tahr, Hirsute Hippo
comments: This is probably my favorite of the maps I made. It creates a lot of tension over Mecatol Rex. It does this without making the home systems closer together as well. All forward docks are adjacent and closer to each other's homesystems. This map will severely weaken the blue tech tree in my estimation.   The systemless spaces in the middle are not a part of the map and are completely impassible. Tiles adjacent to them are not considered on the edge of the game board.

author: DaveBot777
name: The Infamous Double Galaxy 7p
comments: This map requires a gamma wormhole to be placed on Mecatol Rex during setup. The Nexus Sovereignty and Enforced Travel Ban Agendas should be purged during setup.

author: DaveBot777
name: Laneless Double
comments: This map requires a gamma wormhole to be placed on Mecatol Rex during setup. The Nexus Sovereignty and Enforced Travel Ban agendas must be purged during setup.

author: DaveBot777
name: El Ocho
comments: A pretty basic 8 player map with no hyperlanes. Very beginner friendly.

author: DaveBot777
name: Winnarian Warground
comments: This map is almost certainly not balanced. The home systems are not in their standard locations. Who has the advantage? I have no clue.

author: DaveBot777
name: Thin and Wild
comments: With home systems in non-standard positions and a non-standard shape this map is sure to be weird and likely unbalanced.

author: DaveBot777
name: The Link
comments: A pretty standard 3 player map with wormholes linking the map together.

author: Spage
name: Twin Sun Portal
comments: Each equidistant has a wormhole, and each slice has at least 6 influence. Ideally this causes the players to brawl a bit more with each other.

author: bakajszamark
name: Joint galaxies
sliceNames: 1o'clock green: another Vegas;  3o'clock orange: the Lair;   4o'clock white: the tournament standard;   6o'clock blue: It's not the brave men's choice;   8o'clock purple: No more Gravity;   9o'clock yellow: A-steroid B-tween Mecathol;   11o'clock red: PDS paradise
comments: Joint galaxies: fairly balanced, but a little bit assymetrical 7p map.  It's a 5p and a 2p galaxy's collision. And in the middle: there is Hope's end, Primor, and of course  Mecathol. The map is equadistant, but some non-standard positions, has to contest on the way to M.R.  Certainly, there are some good matches, like: Red-XXCHA, orange-Muaat, green-Sardak or yellow-Saar. And ofc, the southern 3 positions suits for the usual power-picks like Barony, L1Z1x, Hacan, Winnu or Titans. What if we have +1 player? No probleam! GL HF!

author: zombiebrains
name: Regicide
sliceNames: The Emperor, The Duke, The Prince, The Countess, The Bishop
comments: I was going for an asymmetrical, almost 4 v 1 but not quite scenario. The Emperor has the strongest position with easy access to MR, 2 legendaries that produce GF, and a blue skip all in an easily defensible position. They are hindered however in the fact that they cannot score victory points without expanding which puts a lot of pressure on the other players to contain  them.   Each other slice has a wormhole with easy resources, a couple of tech skips, and a wormhole to trade. The excess should make VP's easy to score.   The Duke can score an easy 4 planet type point, but his tech skips being in danger make for a tenuous relation with the others.   The Bishop likewise suffers from proximity to the Emperor but is an a thankfully more guarded position. His RY techs might prove the difference in an all out war.   The Prince has the richest slice, and his 2 green skips allow for a potential counter to the Emperor's ground game. But who is willing to trade one tyrant for another?  The Countess's slice largely reflects the Emperor's and a BR tech path opens up options for a lot of factions. Efficient planets with lots of CC's could open up a lot of doors for potential plays.   The problem remains, with only 1 person able to claim the throne, can they work together to stop the looming threat?

author: Reynevan
name: Legends on the Horizon
comments: This was my entry for the second Codex. It is a fun chaotic map, but can be a lot of res and inf for some groups. I enjoyed it with my casual TI4 group.

author: sarbor
name: Choose Your Own Introvert-ture
sliceNames: All Geared Up But Nowhere To Go / Gimme Arinam Meer / No, You Gimme Arinam Meer / Friends <3 / Split Decision / Cozy Corner
comments: Low resource map that minimizes the role of legendary planets and encourages player interaction in certain sectors.

author: FallenWaffle
name: Mixed Player Experience Map
sliceNames: 2-3 games (Intermediate #1), 5+ games (Expert #1), 5+ games (Expert #2), 0 games (Newbie), 2-3 games (Intermediate #2), 2-3 games (Intermediate #3)
comments: A map designed for players with imbalanced experience levels at TI 3 Slices are for people who have some skill with the game, and get a pretty normal setup 1 slice is for someone new, who gets a great first setup (blue skip adjacent to home, protected home system, options on how to expand with a wormhole) 2 slices are for experts (blockers to mecatol rex, and slices that lead both players to fight each other over equidistants like Joel /Accoen.
